se.cbb.jprime.topology

Class RBTreeArcDiscretiser

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.topology.RBTreeArcDiscretiser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dependent, InfoProvider, ProperDependent

    public class RBTreeArcDiscretiser
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProperDependent, InfoProvider
    Discretises an ultrametric host tree by splitting every arc into a number of equidistant slices. This is governed by a user-specified minimum number of slices per edge, nmin, a maximum number, nmax, and an approximate timestep, deltat, (which is never exceeded). The number of slices of an arc with timespan, t, will then be min(max(nmin,ceil(t/deltat)),nmax).

    The number of points of the arc leading into the root can be treated separately if desired.

    Also, it provides access to the times of the arcs and vertices, as well as the mid-points of the equidistant slices.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RBTreeArcDiscretiser

        public RBTreeArcDiscretiser(RBTree S,
                    TimesMap times,
                    int nmin,
                    int nmax,
                    double deltat,
                    int nroot)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        S - host tree.
        times - times of host tree.
        nmin - minimum number of slices per arc.
        nmax - maximum number of slices per arc.
        deltat - approximate timestep. Not used if nmin==nmax.
        nroot - overriding exact number of slices for arc leading into root.

      • cacheAndUpdate

        public void cacheAndUpdate(java.util.Map<Dependent,ChangeInfo> changeInfos,
                  boolean willSample)
        Description copied from interface: ProperDependent
        Caches and updates this object. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed.
        Input: All changes made so far, i.e., changes to dependent objects which precede this in the dependency DAG.
        Output: Changes made to this object are added to the input.

        Behaviour must adhere to the following:

        1. This objects queries input for change info of its parents.
        2. This object caches.
        3. This object sets its own change info (null if it has not changed).
        4. Exit.
        Specified by:
        cacheAndUpdate in interface ProperDependent
        Parameters:
        changeInfos - all changes made so far, including those of this objects parents, if any (null is interpreted as no change).
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.

      • restoreCache

        public void restoreCache(boolean willSample)
        Description copied from interface: ProperDependent
        Restores the cached state when a proposed state has been rejected. It may be assumed that this method will only be invoked if a parent has in fact changed. Note that if the willSample flag is true, it may be necessary to do additional pre-processing on the restored state (since it probably originates from an earlier non-sample iteration).
        Specified by:
        restoreCache in interface ProperDependent
        Parameters:
        willSample - true if the pending state will be sampled; false if not sampled. Invariant over any cacheAndUpdate()-clearCache()/restoreCache() cycle.

      • getArcTime

        public double getArcTime(int x)
        Returns the relative time (arc time) of an arc, indexed by the arc's head x, i.e. time(p(x))-time(x). If x is the root, the "top time" is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the head.
        Returns:
        the arc time.

      • getDiscretisationTimes

        public double[] getDiscretisationTimes(int x)
        Returns the discretisation times for an arc, thus:
        • Index 0: head of arc.
        • Index 1,..,k: discretisation slice midpoints from head to arc.
        • Index k+1: tail of arc (or "tip", if stem arc).
        Parameters:
        x - the head vertex of the arc.
        Returns:
        the discretisation times.

      • getDiscretisationTime

        public double getDiscretisationTime(int x,
                           int i)
        Returns the discretisation time thus:
        • Index 0: head of arc.
        • Index 1,..,k: discretisation slice midpoints from head to arc.
        • Index k+1: tail of arc (or "tip", if stem arc).
        Parameters:
        x - the head vertex of the arc.
        i - the index of the point within the arc.
        Returns:
        the discretisation times
